alert.note: Alert for Dade; Walker (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 12:22AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Walker and northern Dade Counties through 1245 AM EST... At 1222 AM EST, a strong thunderstorm was near Higdon, or near Bridgeport, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Trenton, Fort Oglethorpe, Lookout Mountain, Chattanooga Valley, Cole City, Wildwood, Fairview, Stephensville, Chattanooga Valley, New England, Morganville, Hooker and Lakeview. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
